Payload.SurveyTitle: Online Survey Software | Qualtrics Survey Solutions

SurveyElements.SecondaryAttribute: Discriminative Turns When we engage in conversation with another person, we make use of the words...

Payload.QuestionText:
Discriminative Turns

When we engage in a conversation with another person, we make use of the words that are spoken as well as the way in which they are said to understand what someone means. The exact same phrase can be said in ways that mean completely different things.


Task

During each round of this task, you'll be presented with segments of real phone conversations. Each segment consists of at least a turn and a response in this form:

The initial turn
The response
OR
The initial turn
The response
Each set of conversation-segments that you will be presented with contains the true turn-response pair that occurred in the phone conversation; the rest are synthetically generated. 
 
Your task

In each experiment, your task is to assign each audio segment a score of how likely it is to be the true turn-response, with scores ranging from 'very likely', to 'very unlikely'.
 

Along with the turn-response segments to choose between, you will receive a varying degree of additional information about the rest of the conversation which you can use to help make your decision.
